page.title: 16THE NANTYMOEL TRAIL
page.content: 1. START AT THE TERMINUS OF TRAMWAY IN NANT-Y-MOEL. THIS WAS ONE OF THE EARLIEST METHODS OF TRANSPORTING COAL USING STATIONARY STEAM ENGINES. 2. ON THE EASTERN SIDE OF NANT_Y_MOEL IS THE OCEAN COLLIERY_ THIS IS THE EASTERN PART OF THE WYNDHAM-WESTERN COLLIERY,THE LAST WORKING PIT IN THE OGMORE VALLEY. THE OCEAN WAS OPERATIONAL IN 1873. 3. GAFFERS ROW OVERLOOKS THE OCEAN COLLIERY. IT IS A ROW OF TERRACED HOMES BUILT FOR THE "BOSSES". 4. THE BERWYN CENTRE, PRICETOWN, HAS BEEN THE CENTRE OF COMMUNITY ACTIVITIES SINCE 1901. 5. THE DINAM CHAPEL IS A CALVANISTIC METHODIST CHAPEL, WHICH WAS THE MOST POPULAR FORM OF METHODISM IN WALES.DAVID DAVIES,THE OWNER OF THE OCEAN COLLIERY,PROVIDED THE MONEY TO BUILD THE CHAPEL.
